items.title: In Redistricting Battles, Here’s How Trump, Republicans and Democrats Are Faring
items.summary: President Trump is imploring lawmakers to redraw their congressional maps to stave off Democratic control of the House. But the debate over redistricting has revealed fissures within both parties.

items.title: Elections Across the U.S. Will Test Democrats’ Momentum Ahead of 2026 Midterms
items.summary: Democrats have no federal contests that would allow them to check President Trump’s power, but governors’ races, mayoral contests and referendums will test momentum and divisions in both parties.

items.title: The Nationwide Battle Over Electoral Maps
items.summary: What began with Texas drawing what could be five new Republican districts in the House of Representatives at President Trump’s behest has spiraled into a nationwide redistricting race. Nick Corasaniti, a New York Times reporter covering national politics, gives an overview.

items.title: Supreme Court Confronts Trump and His Tariffs in Test of Presidential Power
items.summary: The justices face so-called legitimacy dilemma as they deal with a tricky legal dispute and a president who has made clear he would view defeat as a personal insult.

items.title: ‘Political Scores’ Use Reams of Data to Predict Your Vote
items.summary: Meet Mark Grebner, the Michigan statistician who helped pioneer the science of predicting whether someone will vote Republican or Democratic.

items.title: The Monthslong Legal Battle to Save Foreign Aid
items.summary: One lawsuit, underway since February, has sought to compel President Trump to honor Congress’s vision for foreign aid. It still has a long way to go.

items.title: US government shutdown nearing record for longest in history as Trump delays food benefits to millions – US politics live
items.summary: <p>Republicans claim US president ‘desperate’ to end shutdown, which has now entered 33rd day</p><p>Tuesday is Election Day in several states. It will be an early indication of how voters feel in the first year of the second Trump administration.</p><p>Both Democrats and Republicans will be carefully watching the outcomes in the gubernatorial races in <strong>Virginia</strong> and <strong>New Jersey</strong>, the high-profile mayoral contest in <strong>New York</strong> and the electorally significant redistricting referendum in <strong>California</strong>, where Democrats have asked voters to approve redrawing the state’s congressional map.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/03/us-government-shutdown-donald-trump-latest-politics-news">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Philadelphia’s progressive district attorney seeks third term as shootings decline. Critics contend he’s soft on criminals
items.summary: <p>Larry Krasner is favored to be re-elected on 4 November while progressive prosecutors around the country have been losing favor with voters</p><p><em>This story was originally published by<a href="https://www.thetrace.org/2025/10/larry-krasner-election-kada-scott-philly/"> </a></em><em><a href="https://www.thetrace.org/2025/10/larry-krasner-election-kada-scott-philly/">the Trace</a>, a non-profit newsroom covering gun violence in America. <a href="http://www.thetrace.org/newsletter">Sign up for its newsletters here</a>.</em></p><p>As Philadelphia’s district attorney, Larry Krasner, attempted to explain himself, a pensive scowl replaced the look of assured confidence usually etched on his face.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/03/philadelphia-progressive-district-attorney-larry-krasner-third-term">Continue reading...</a>
